FacilityName: Aerosols Danville Inc. DBA Voyant Beauty

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
gement program for its aerosol packaging process operation and maintenance. The PSM program has been incorporated as both policy, and most importantly, procedure in everyday operations and maintenance of the aerosol packaging process. Some of the safety measures that are in place to ensure the safety of Aerosols Danville Inc. DBA Voyant Beauty employees and the surrounding community include:

- Gas detection systems are installed in areas where there is a potential for hazardous levels of flammable gas to accumulate.
- State of the art explosion suppression systems have been installed in all areas where flammable gas is transferred to aerosol containers. These systems are designed to detect and extinguish an ignition before a catastrophic explosion can occur.
- All storage tanks that store hazardous materials are inspected on a periodic basis.
- Periodic inspections are performed to ensure that all process equipment is adequately grounded. This reduces the chance of hazardous static electricity discharge that could ignite flammable vapors.
- Tankers are equipped with emergency shutdown capability, adding to the safety of the unloading process.
- Pressure relief valves are installed on the storage tanks and piping systems.
- Standardized operating procedures are utilized for unloading and handling of flammable materials.
- Ventilation systems are installed to prevent the accumulation of flammable vapors in processing areas.
- Water cannons are installed near the propellant tanks to aid in cooling tanks, or assist if firefighting, if required

FIVE-YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY: 
There have been no accidents or injuries related to the covered process during the past five years.

EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM: 
Aerosols Danville Inc. DBA Voyant Beauty has established an Emergency Action Plan (EAP) to ensure appropriate steps are taken to protect public health and the environment, as well as the safety of plant employees.  The EAP is designed to address foreseeable

emergency situations at the facility and provide appropriate hazard and emergency preparedness information to employees, contractors, emergency response personnel, and the community.  Emergency situations can include fire, explosion, chemical release or spill, bomb threats, weather emergencies, site security (i.e., terrorism) and other natural emergencies.
Aerosols Danville Inc. DBA Voyant Beauty has developed procedures to be followed in the event of an emergency and a command structure to evaluate an emergency to determine the appropriate action to be taken to remedy it.  Aerosols Danville Inc. DBA Voyant Beauty staff has a first response capability and can administer basic first aid and CPR. Aerosols Danville Inc. DBA Voyant Beauty will rely on the Westville Area Fire Department and the Vermillion County Local Emergency Planning Committee (LEPC) for assistance in controlling emergency releases and extinguishing fires.

PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY: 
Aerosols Danville Inc. DBA Voyant Beauty is committed through its grass-roots Continuous Improvement process to the expansion and refinement of its safety programs with special emphasis on training. Aerosols Danville Inc. DBA Voyant Beauty facilities maintain active safety committees with broad involvement in training, incident investigation, and auditing. These efforts are supplemented by a Divisional Auditing Program for general and critical safety. Aerosols Danville Inc. utilizes external professional resources to validate its internal programs and activities. Aerosols Danville Inc. DBA Voyant Beauty also maintains strong contact with local fire and emergency management agencies, participating in mock disaster training exercises.
